com.konakart.util
Class Security

java.lang.Object
  com.konakart.util.Security

public class Security
extends java.lang.Object

Class for managing password encryption. You may customize this class by adding your own encryption algorithm.

Method Detail

encrypt

public static java.lang.String encrypt(java.lang.String password)
                                throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
Encrypts the password using the chosen algorithm and returns the encrypted password.

Parameters:
password - in clear text
Returns:
Returns an encrypted password
Throws:
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the chosen algorithm isn't available.

checkPassword

public static boolean checkPassword(java.lang.String dbPassword,
                                    java.lang.String password)
                             throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
Compare the hashed password from the DB with the one in clear text provided by the user. The clear text password must be encrypted using the chosen algorithm and then compared with the hashed password stored in the database.

Parameters:
dbPassword - raw encrypted password value from the database
password - the password in clear text as entered by the user
Returns:
Returns true if the password matches the one in the database. Otherwise returns false.
Throws:
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the chosen algorithm isn't available.
